alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Madison and Hancock Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenfield, or 16 miles north of Shelbyville, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anderson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 214 and 229. Interstate 70 between mile markers 99 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
